title: Proud Boys

In a speech, he described a clash with Antifa outside a talk he gave at NYU last year: 'My guys are left to fight. And here's the crucial part: We do. And we beat the crap out of them.' He related what a Proud Boy who got arrested told him afterward: 'It was really, really fun.' According to McInnes: 'Violence doesn't feel good. Justified violence feels great. And fighting solves everything.'}}</ref><ref name="Gdn20181119"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Rosenberg|first=Eli|date=November 19, 2018|title=, law enforcement officials say|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/20/fbi-says-proud-boys-have-white-nationalist-ties-law-enforcement-officials-say/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181128123010/https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/20/fbi-says-proud-boys-have-white-nationalist-ties-law-enforcement-officials-say/|archive-date=November 28, 2018|access-date=November 29, 2018|work=The Washington Post}}</ref> While the group claims to reject racism, several members have been affiliated with [[white supremacy]], and the Proud Boys has been described by US intelligence organizations as an extremist group.<ref name="SPLC"/><ref name="Guardian Belam 2020">{{cite news|last1=Belam|first1=Martin|last2=Gabbatt|first2=Adam|date=2020-09-30|title=Proud Boys: who are the far-right group that backs Donald Trump?|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/30/proud-boys-who-are-far-right-group-that-backs-donald-trump|url-status=live|access-date=October 1, 2020|issn=0261-3077|archive-date=October 11, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201011162420/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/30/proud-boys-who-are-far-right-group-that-backs-donald-trump}}</ref><ref name="WTP Hawkins 2020">{{cite news|last1=Hawkins|first1=Derek|last2=Jr|first2=Cleve R. Post|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2020/09/30/proudboys1001/|access-date=2020-10-01|issn=0190-8286|quote=Proud Boys have ties to white supremacists and sometimes use nationalist rhetoric Jazeera]]|url=https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2020/10/2/trump-denounces-all-white-supremacists-including-proud-boys|url-status=live|access-date=October 4, 2020|quote=US President Donald Trump has news|last=Shannon|first=Joel|date=September 30, 2020|title=Who are the Proud Boys? Far-right group has concerned experts for years|work=USA Today|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/09/30/who-proud-boys-group-mentioned-debate-has-violent-history/5868406002/|url-status=live|access-date=October 4, 2020|quote=The Proud Boys, a far-right group with a history of violent confrontations, is gaining increased national scrutiny as academics and advocates have warned the group has ties to white supremacy.|archive-date=October 2, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201002043549/https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/nation/2020/09/30/who-proud-boys-group-mentioned-debate-has-violent-history/5868406002/}}}}</ref> The group originated in the far-right ''[[Taki's Magazine]]''<ref>{{cite web|last=Coaston|first=Jane|date=October 15, 2018|title=The Proud Boys, the bizarre far-right street fighters behind violence in New York, explained|url=https://www.vox.com/2018/10/15/17978358/proud-boys-gavin-mcinnes-manhattan-gop-violence|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181017001652/https://www.vox.com/2018/10/15/17978358/proud-boys-gavin-mcinnes-manhattan-gop-violence|archive-date=October 17, 2018|accessdate=October 1, 2020|website=Vox}}</ref> in 2016 under the leadership of [[Vice Media]] co-founder and former commentator [[Gavin McInnes]], taking its name from the song "[[Proud of Your Boy]]" from the 2011 Disney musical ''[[Aladdin (2011 musical)|Aladdin]]''.<ref name="Disser 2016">{{cite web|last=Disser|first=Nicole|date=July 28, 2016|title=Gavin McInnes and his Proud Boys want to make white men great again|url=http://bedfordandbowery.com/2016/07/gavin-mcinnes-and-his-proud-boys-want-to-make-white-men-great-again/|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190209020443/https://bedfordandbowery.com/2016/07/gavin-mcinnes-and-his-proud-boys-want-to-make-white-men-great-again/|archive-date=February 9, 2019|access-date=|website=Bedford + Bowery|publisher=New York}}</ref><ref name="Wired1">Ellis, Emma Grey (May 22, 2017).  [https://www.wired.com/2017/05/field-guide-far-right/ "Your Handy Field Guide to the Many Factions of the Far Right, from the Proud Boys to Identity Evropa"]. ''Wired''. {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170831222550/https://www.wired.com/2017/05/field-guide-far-right/|date=August 31, 2017}}. Retrieved October 16, 2018.</ref> Although the Proud Boys emerged as part of the [[alt-right]], McInnes distanced himself from this movement in early 2017, saying the Proud Boys was "[[alt-light]]" while the alt-right's focus was [[Race and ethnicity in the United States|race]].<ref name="Marantz"/> The re-branding effort intensified following the white supremacist [[Unite the Right rally]].<ref name="Woodhouse">{{cite news|last1=Woodhouse|first1=Leighton Akio|title=After Charlottesville, the American Far Right is Tearing Itself Apart|url=https://theintercept.com/2017/09/21/gavin-mcinnes-alt-right-proud-boys-richard-spencer-charlottesville/|accessdate=January 10, 2018|website=The Intercept|date=September 21, 2017|archive-date=January 10, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180110234211/https://theintercept.com/2017/09/21/gavin-mcinnes-alt-right-proud-boys-richard-spencer-charlottesville/|url-status=live}}</ref> Since early 2019, [[Enrique Tarrio]], who identifies as Afro-Cuban, has been the chairman of the Proud Boys.<ref name="NYT MacFarquhar 2020"/><ref name="Glaser 2019"/><ref name="Sidner 2020"/>

title: Proud Boys
deleted: organization.}}}}</ref> and male-only<ref name="VoxMetro" /> [[political organization]]<ref>{{bulleted list|1={{cite book|last=Sernau|first=Scott|title=Social Inequality in a Global Age|publisher=[[SAGE Publications]]|year=2019|isbn=9781544309309|quote=The Proud Boys, an all-male neo-fascist group [...].}}|2={{cite book|last=Álvarez|first=Rebecca|title=Vigilante Gender Violence: Social Class, the Gender Bargain, and Mob Attacks on Women Worldwide|publisher=Routledge|year=2020|isbn=978-1000174137|quote=The Proud Boys are a neo-fascist masculinist hate group.}}}}</ref> that promotes and engages in [[political violence]] in the United States and Canada.<ref name="indigenous">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-41116175|title='Proud Boys' back in Canada military after crashing indigenous ceremony|publisher=BBC News|date=August 31, 2017|access-date=July 21, 2018|archive-date=June 27, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180627091629/https://www.bbc.com/news/world-us-canada-41116175|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="Guardian2018"/><ref name="NatRev">{{cite news|last1=Lowry|first1=Rich|date=October 19, 2018|title=The Poisonous Allure of Right-Wing Violence|work=National Review|url=https://www.nationalreview.com/2018/10/gavin-mcinnes-proud-boys-poisonous-violence/|url-status=live|accessdate=November 13, 2018|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181022045754/https://www.nationalreview.com/2018/10/gavin-mcinnes-proud-boys-poisonous-violence/|archive-date=October 22, 2018|quote=McInnes is open about his glorification of violence. In a speech, he described a clash with Antifa outside a talk he gave at NYU last year: 'My guys are left to fight. And here's the crucial part: We do. And we beat the crap out of them.' He related what a Proud Boy who got arrested told him afterward: 'It was really, really fun.' According to McInnes: 'Violence doesn't feel good. Justified violence feels great. And fighting solves everything.'}}</ref><ref name="Gdn20181119"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Rosenberg|first=Eli|date=November 19, 2018|title=FBI considers Proud Boys extremists with white-nationalist ties, law enforcement officials say|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/20/fbi-says-proud-boys-have-white-nationalist-ties-law-enforcement-officials-say/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181128123010/https://www.washingtonpost.com/nation/2018/11/20/fbi-says-proud-boys-have-white-nationalist-ties-law-enforcement-officials-say/|archive-date=November 28, 2018|access-date=November 29, 2018|work=The Washington Post}}</ref> While the group claims to reject racism, several members have been affiliated with [[white supremacy]], and the Proud Boys has been described by US intelligence organizations as an extremist group.<ref name="SPLC"/><ref name="Guardian Belam 2020">{{cite news|last1=Belam|first1=Martin|last2=Gabbatt|first2=Adam|date=2020-09-30|title=Proud Boys: who are the far-right group that backs Donald Trump?|language=en-GB|work=The Guardian|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/30/proud-boys-who-are-far-right-group-that-backs-donald-trump|url-status=live|access-date=October 1, 2020|issn=0261-3077|archive-date=October 11, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201011162420/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/sep/30/proud-boys-who-are-far-right-group-that-backs-donald-trump}}</ref><ref name="WTP Hawkins 2020">{{cite news|last1=Hawkins|first1=Derek|last2=Jr|first2=Cleve R.
